info.title: Uptempo User Service API
info.description: API of Uptempo User Service including the management of a user and related objects

license.name: Uptempo License. Copyright Uptempo IO. All rights reserved.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: Manage and search Uptempo users

tags.name: User Preferences
tags.description: Personal preferences for a user like language, timezone, etc. User preferences object is created together with User object

tags.name: Personal Data
tags.description: Personal data contains user's personal data like phone, fax, etc. Personal data object is created together with User object.

tags.name: Addresses
tags.description: User's address. User can have several addresses (e.g. invoice/delivery/physical)

tags.name: Roles
tags.description: Role contains a set of permissions. User can have one role for each role type

tags.name: Permissions
tags.description: If user has a permission, then he has access to a specific functionality. User can obtain a permission if he has a role which contains the permission

tags.name: Organizational Unit
tags.description: Organizational unit (Department). One user must be a part of one organizational unit.

tags.name: Groups
tags.description: User group. One user can be a member of many groups. See GroupMemberships for managing the user group memberships

tags.name: Group Memberships
tags.description: Represents User's membership in a Group. One user can be a part of many Groups.

tags.name: Group-Role-User Assignments
tags.description: Group Role pairs assignments for Users. A user can have several assignments, but only one assignment for one Group

tags.name: Sso Groups
tags.description: SSO group is used for assigning roles and data to user during SSO authentication and user creation

tags.name: Group-Role-Sso Assignments
tags.description: Group Role pairs assignments for SSO Groups. A SSO Group can have several assignments, but only one assignment for one Group

tags.name: Virtual Database Groups
tags.description: Virtual Database Group contains a list of virtual databases. One user can have only one virtual database group. Virtual Databases are used e.g. in Media Pool

tags.name: Virtual Databases
tags.description: Virtual database. Can be used for grouping data e.g. in Media Pool. Virtual database is assigned to user via the Virtual database groups

tags.name: Substitution Configurations
tags.description: Resource Management substitution configuration of a user. E.g. when user goes to vacation he configures substitution settings and sets his substitution mode. Then it's applied and Substitutes objects are used for substitution logic

tags.name: Substitutes
tags.description: Resource Management Substitute of the user. E.g. when delegator goes to vacation he can select several substitutes per type/group

tags.name: Company Calendars
tags.description: Resource Management company calendars represents company vacation days

tags.name: User Calendars
tags.description: Resource Management user calendars represents user personal vacation calendar

tags.name: Calendar Ranges
tags.description: Resource Management calendar ranges. Calendars represent user personal vacation calendar or company calendars

tags.name: Working Hours
tags.description: Resource Management user's working hours for each day of a week

tags.name: Resource Management Users
tags.description: Resource management-specific user object which hold relations to other resource management objects

tags.name: User Data Types
tags.description: User generic data contains data which can be registered separately. Any service can register it's user fields, so they can be stored in User service. Usually service-specific data is stored here

tags.name: User Data Values
tags.description: Values for UserDataTypes for each user

tags.name: Labels
tags.description: User's labels - unique strings / tags which can be assigned to a user

tags.name: Distribution Lists
tags.description: Distribution list is a list of email recipients

tags.name: Defaults
tags.description: Per-application defaults

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: Webhooks called by User Platform

tags.name: Frontend
tags.description: Frontend-related REST endpoints

get.description:
There are 3 cases when calling this endpoint, which will produce different behaviour.
1. Calling it with a web token (generated via UI user login) - This will return the actual logged user’s data such as id, login, email, permissions etc.
2. Calling it with a client token and CurrentUser header (the X-User-Login header is still valid) - this will return the user data associated with the provided header’s login.
3. Calling it with a client token with no CurrentUser or X-User-Login header - this will return hard coded System User data + its permissions. Please note that in this case, the **include** parameter is not applied. Here’s an example of it:
```
{
    "id": "00000000-0000-7000-0000-000000000000",
    "version": "00000000-0000-7000-0000-000000000000",
    "createdAt": "2000-01-01T00:00:00Z",
    "email": "no-reply@uptempo.io",
    "firstName": "__System__",
    "lastName": "__User__",
    "login": "__System__User__",
    "createdBy": "__System__User__",
    "fullName": "__System__User__",
    "status": "ENABLED",
    "creationType": "MANUAL",
    "rights": [
        "authenticated",
        "BrandMakerSystemUser",
        "uma_authorization",
        "user-svc-admin",
        "auth-svc-admin",
        "offline_access",
        "admin_see-all-personal-data"
    ]
}
```
Query parameters are joined by AND relation
Query parameters are joined by AND relation

/user/app/health.summary: MicroProfile Health provides a way for your application to distribute information about its healthiness state to state whether or not it is able to function properly

get.summary: An aggregated view of the Liveness, Readiness and Startup of this application
get.description: Check the health of the application

/user/app/health/live.summary: Liveness checks are utilized to tell whether the application should be restarted

get.summary: The Liveness check of this application
get.description: Check the liveness of the application

/user/app/health/ready.summary: Readiness checks are used to tell whether the application is able to process requests

get.summary: The Readiness check of this application
get.description: Check the readiness of the application

/user/app/health/started.summary: Startup checks are an used to tell when the application has started

failedLoginAttemptsAmount.description: Max attempts for login with wrong credentials, after that user will be locked

type.description: Groups can be used completely separately using a 'type' field. E.g. mapl groups have 'mapl' type and BM groups - 'team' type

Type in a combination with a name presents an unique permission full name.
Every separate part of functionality / service / module should have it's own type and a subset of permissions.
For BM type is a module short name - e.g. 'jm','mp', etc.
